channel.title: Python on DevOps Engineer
channel.description: Recent content in Python on DevOps Engineer

item.title: Full Record｜PyCon LT 2025 Day Three - Can AI Replace You?
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: Today was the final day of PyCon LT 2025, themed AI and ML Day. It featured several excellent talks by female speakers and provided new insights into data science and AI.

item.title: Full Record｜PyCon LT 2025 Day Two - Charmed by Several Female Developers
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: Today was Data Day at PyCon LT 2025, focusing on Dataframes, Databases, and Orchestration. While not deeply familiar with these areas, I was deeply impressed by several female speakers and gained a lot.

item.title: Full Record｜PyCon LT 2025 Day One - My Experiences at an International Python Conference
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: Sharing my experiences, presentation content, and thoughts on the Python community from the first day of PyCon LT 2025.

item.title: pip vs pipx Differences
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article introduces the differences between pip and pipx, helping developers choose the right tool to manage Python packages and command-line tools.

item.title: Is Your Python Code Pythonic Enough?
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article introduces the concept of Pythonic code and demonstrates through examples how to write more concise and elegant Python code, helping developers improve code quality and readability.

item.title: Publishing a Python Project on GitHub — Things to Note
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article introduces the important aspects to consider when publishing a Python project on GitHub, including project structure, dependency management, and version control.

item.title: About Python pip install and versioning
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: Explains the behavior of pip install commands with different versioning schemes, including how to handle beta versions and the implications of using --upgrade with specific version numbers.
